title: Fix bracketed paste edge case: naive pattern search
description: Bracketed paste termination uses naive ESC[201~ pattern search inside paste data. Pastes containing that byte sequence could truncate early, and >64KiB pastes error out with PasteBufferFull. Fix: proper state machine parsing that distinguishes real terminator from pasted content.

title: Async/event loop integration
description: pollEvent is blocking/polling. Integration with async runtimes (io_uring, epoll wrappers) is not defined. Consider providing a file descriptor for integration with external event loops, or async variants of poll functions.

title: Buffer.resize: add preserve-content variant
description: Buffer.resize always clears content; no preserve-content variant or copy-on-resize helper. Add resizePreserving() that copies existing cells to new buffer, clipping or padding as needed.

title: Testing: input pollEvent integration and bracketed paste flows
description: Input.pollEvent integration (poll/read + escape timeout) and full bracketed paste flows are untested; only decoder unit tests exist. Add integration tests for: 1) pollEvent with real PTY, 2) Bracketed paste start/end sequences, 3) Escape timeout behavior.

title: Testing: large bracketed paste spanning multiple reads
description:
Current bracketed paste tests use small content that fits within Input's 256-byte input_buf and arrives in a single read.

Add test with paste content >256 bytes (e.g., 1KB or more) that spans multiple reads/pollEvent iterations. Verify a single .paste event is emitted with the complete payload.

This exercises the paste buffering logic when content arrives in chunks.

title: Testing: Windows backend behavior
description: Windows backend behavior (key/mouse/resize translation, UTF-16 surrogate handling) lacks tests; only detectCapabilities is exercised. Add tests for: 1) Key event translation, 2) Mouse coordinate handling, 3) Resize events, 4) UTF-16 to UTF-8 conversion.

title: Termcat terminal I/O core (termbox2-style library)
description: Deliver a minimal, fast cell-based terminal I/O library (termbox2 style) for Zig with clean API, solid POSIX backend, input decoding, buffered renderer, and docs/demos.

title: Write API/design doc for termcat core
description: Draft a short design doc that scopes the library (termbox2-style cell API), targets (POSIX first, Windows as follow-up), and public API surface. Capture event types (keys, mouse, resize, paste, focus), cell representation, color/depth support, and backend plan. Include testing/fixture plan (pty harness) and milestones for MVP vs optional work.
acceptance_criteria: Doc covers target platforms, API surface (init/shutdown, event polling, draw/flush), buffer model, input model, capability matrix, testing strategy, and MVP vs follow-ups.

title: POSIX terminal setup/teardown and capability detection
description: Implement the POSIX backend bootstrap: termios raw mode (no echo, cbreak), alternate screen, hide cursor, mouse + bracketed paste toggles, and SIGINT/SIGTSTP friendliness. Restore original state on drop and on error paths. Detect terminal size and color depth via terminfo/env (truecolor/256/16) with sane defaults. Add smoke tests with a pty harness for init/restore.
acceptance_criteria: API can enter/exit raw+alternate screen safely, restore state on drop/panic, enable/disable mouse+bracketed paste, report rows/cols, and expose color depth capability (truecolor/256/16).

title: Cell buffer and diff-based renderer
description: Build the core cell grid and renderer: maintain a back buffer of cells (grapheme/attrs/colors), support resize, clear/fill, and set cell APIs. Implement a diffing flush that computes minimal updates vs previous frame, groups writes, and emits ANSI sequences. Handle wide characters and combining marks (East Asian width) without corrupting alignment. Expose a present() call that fails gracefully if terminal size changed.
acceptance_criteria: Offscreen buffer stores glyph+attrs+colors, supports clear/set/fill, and flush emits minimal ANSI updates (grouped writes) handling double-width cells; provides API to present frame and returns size mismatch errors.

title: Input decoding and event model
description: Implement input pipeline: nonblocking read with poll/select, parse escape sequences for arrows/F-keys/home/end, ctrl/alt/meta combos, xterm SGR mouse, bracketed paste, focus in/out. Deliver events through a clear enum/struct with modifier bitmask and timestamps. Handle partial/ambiguous sequences by buffering with timeout. Emit resize events from SIGWINCH hook.
acceptance_criteria: Nonblocking/timeout poll returns events for keys (including modifiers/F-keys), mouse (SGR), resize, paste, and focus; partial escape sequences are buffered; API exposes event enum and modifier bitmask.

title: Color/attribute pipeline and capability fallbacks
description: Define the color/attribute model and mapping. Provide constants and helpers for truecolor, 256-color, and 16-color palettes with automatic downgrades based on capability detection. Wire attributes (bold, underline, italic, reverse, dim) into renderer output. Document behavior for unsupported attributes and palette clamping.
acceptance_criteria: API supports fg/bg truecolor + 256 + 16-color palettes with graceful downgrade based on detected capability; exposes attribute bitset (bold/underline/italic/reverse/dim); renderer maps styles to correct ANSI sequences and clamps invalid values.

title: Unicode width and grapheme handling
description: Add grapheme-aware handling to the cell grid: compute display width (wcwidth/East Asian width), merge combining marks into a single cell payload, and ensure diff logic respects double-width cells when writing to the terminal. Provide tests covering wide glyphs, combining accents, emoji, and invalid sequences.
acceptance_criteria: Renderer correctly places double-width/East Asian characters, combining marks render as single cell with previous base, and invalid/zero-width sequences are replaced with a placeholder without breaking alignment.

title: PTY-based integration tests for init/input/render
description: Build a pty-backed test harness (e.g., spawn a child that uses termcat) to verify: raw-mode init/restore, resize propagation, key/mouse/paste decoding, and diff rendering output. Capture small golden frames for renderer tests and ensure cursor/alternate screen state is restored after failures. Wire into  or similar.
acceptance_criteria: Automated tests spin up a pty, run init/shutdown, send escape sequences for keys/mouse/paste to verify decoding, and assert diff renderer output matches expectations; CI target added.

title: Examples and README for termcat
description: Add user-facing docs and samples: update README with goals, capability notes, and basic usage code. Provide at least two examples (input/event logger and color/grid demo) that exercise rendering and input paths. Note platform support and limitations discovered so far.
acceptance_criteria: README documents public API and capabilities; at least two examples (e.g., input logger, color grid) build/run; documented build/test instructions.

title: Windows console backend (ConPTY/Win32)
description: Add a Windows backend using Win32 console APIs or ConPTY. Support entering raw/unbuffered mode, translating key/mouse events into the shared event model, and writing color/attribute output with best-effort parity to POSIX. Document any capability gaps or behavioral differences.
acceptance_criteria: Windows backend enters/leaves raw-ish mode, renders cells with colors/attrs, and decodes key/mouse events into the shared event model with documented gaps.

title: POSIX capability detection improvements
description: POSIX capability detection is heuristic (TERM substrings) and may disable mouse/paste/focus on capable but unknown terminals. Consider: 1) Query terminal via XTGETTCAP/DA sequences, 2) More comprehensive TERM matching, 3) User override options.

title: Text layout primitives: wrapping, alignment, box drawing
description: Both reviewers noted that users must manually calculate x/y coordinates. No support for: text wrapping (print clips at edge), alignment (center/right), box/line drawing helpers. Add Layout helpers or extend Buffer/Plane with wrap(), center(), drawBox().

title: Theming system for consistent styles
description: Styles are hardcoded per cell. A Theme system would allow consistent color/attribute schemes across the application. Consider Theme struct with named colors (primary, secondary, error, etc.) and style presets.

title: Terminal control: cursor styles, bell, title, hyperlinks
description: No cursor style control (block/underline/bar), bell (\x07), window title setters, or OSC 8 hyperlink support. Add Terminal.setCursorStyle(), Terminal.bell(), Terminal.setTitle(), Terminal.hyperlink().

title: Widget library: basic Label, Button, InputField, ScrollView
description: Gemini noted that a basic widget library is missing but essential for productivity. This would make termcat a full TUI framework rather than just a foundation. Consider: Label (styled text), Button (click handler), InputField (text input with cursor), ScrollView (scrollable content area).

title: Auto dirty-tracking for Plane drawing operations
Testing: escape timeout edge cases with split writes
description:
Current escape timeout tests write complete sequences in one shot (e.g., \x1b[A), which bypasses the timing ambiguity Input.pollEvent is meant to resolve.

Add tests that:
1. Write \x1b alone, wait >escape_timeout_ms, verify bare Escape event is emitted
2. Write \x1b, wait <escape_timeout_ms, write [A, verify Up arrow (not Escape + garbage)
3. Write \x1b, wait >escape_timeout_ms, write a, verify Escape then 'a' as separate events

This exercises the actual escape timeout disambiguation logic.

title: Fix POSIX resize: single static atomic race condition
description: POSIX resize notification uses a single static atomic and global SIGWINCH handler. Multiple backends/threads will race and lose events. Consider per-backend signalfd or pipe-based notification.

title: Extended Unicode: grapheme clusters, ZWJ sequences, >2 combining marks
description: MAX_COMBINING=2 limits rendering of complex scripts. Grapheme clusters with ZWJ/emoji sequences (like family emoji) and >2 combining marks are unsupported. Consider dynamic combining mark storage or configurable MAX_COMBINING.

title: Fuzz testing for input decoder
description: The input decoder handles untrusted byte streams from terminal input and should be fuzz tested. Use zig's built-in fuzz testing or AFL to find edge cases in escape sequence parsing.

title: Documentation: end-to-end pipeline guide
description: No end-to-end guide for the intended pipeline (backend -> plane/compositor -> renderer -> flush) or when to invalidate regions after plane changes, moves, or visibility toggles. Add comprehensive docs explaining: 1) Basic usage flow, 2) When to invalidate, 3) Paste buffer lifetime/size limits, 4) Windows vs POSIX differences.

title: macOS: demos ignore keyboard input
description:
Environment: macOS (Ghostty), running demos (e.g. ./zig-out/bin/input_logger or zig build demo).

Steps:
1) zig build
2) run a demo (input_logger/color_grid/demo)
3) press keys (e.g. q)

Actual: no key events are logged and the app never exits.
Expected: keypresses are delivered and q quits.

Root cause: PosixBackend opens /dev/tty and polls it for input. On macOS, poll(/dev/tty) returns POLLNVAL, so the input loop never reads from the tty and keystrokes stay queued (you can read them from the pty slave later). stdin is a pollable tty, but we werenâ€™t using it.

Fix: when stdin is a tty, use it for input polling/reads while keeping /dev/tty for termios/raw mode + output. Updated PosixBackend to carry an input_fd, feed it to Input, and use it for poll/read.

Validation: pty harness now shows input_logger logs the q key and exits; color_grid exits on q; zig build test passes.

title: Implement Kitty keyboard protocol (CSI u) for Ghostty compatibility
Windows backend: implement bracketed paste support
description: Bracketed paste is explicitly disabled in windows.zig but Windows 10+ consoles support it. Implement bracketed paste support for Windows to ensure parity with POSIX. Also fix capability detection to not assume true_color unconditionally.

title: Rich compositor: layered planes and blitting
description: Introduce a lightweight compositor on top of the cell renderer: layered planes with z-ordering, clipping, and reusable blits/sprites so callers can compose UIs without manual full-screen redraws.

title: Plane abstraction with z-order and clipping
description: Define a plane type wrapping a cell grid region with parent-relative origin/size. Support create/destroy, reorder (raise/lower), move/resize, and set visibility. Enforce clipping to parent bounds and track stacking order. Provide helper to translate between plane-local and screen coordinates. Add unit tests covering stacking, clipping, resize, and visibility toggles.
acceptance_criteria: APIs can create/destroy planes (root + children), set z-order, move/resize with clipping, and iterate visible stack; invariants: children clipped to parent, no overlapping memory corruption, and lookups return correct global coords.

title: Composition pipeline with dirty regions
description: Implement the compositor pass: walk planes in z-order, apply clipping, and compose into a scratch/back buffer with a notion of transparent cells (skip). Track per-plane dirty rectangles and coalesce into frame-level dirty regions passed to the renderer diff. Ensure plane move/resize/visibility changes correctly invalidate regions. Add tests for damage tracking and correct composition order.
acceptance_criteria: Compositor can merge planes into a target buffer honoring z-order and transparency, compute dirty rectangles per frame, and feed them to the diff renderer; resizing or plane moves mark correct regions dirty.

title: Blitting and sprite API with transparency
description: Add blit helpers to copy sub-rectangles between planes or from standalone cell buffers. Support transparent cells (no overwrite) to allow sprite-style overlays. Include options for tiling/repeat fill and clipping when source/dest exceed bounds. Provide tests for transparent holes, partial blits, and tiled fills.
acceptance_criteria: API supports blitting a source cell buffer/plane region into a target plane with optional transparent cells, cropping to dest bounds, and repeat/tiling; tests cover partial overlaps and transparency holes.

title: Compositor regression tests (pty + golden frames)
description: Extend the pty test harness to exercise the compositor: construct layered planes with transparency holes, move/resize planes, and verify final terminal output matches expected golden frames. Include checks that dirty-region tracking limits writes (no full-screen redraws for small moves).
acceptance_criteria: Tests render layered planes via compositor in a pty, capture frames, and assert correct z-order, clipping, transparency, and minimal dirty regions for moves/resizes.
